intro: Gracielanthus pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramid plant, is a unique succulent native to South Africa. It features a compact, branching structure with triangular, fleshy leaves that form a pyramid-like shape. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the growing season. Due to its striking appearance and low maintenance, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening.
